What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_List: This course teaches you basic Italian skills relatively efficiently. I came in with a knowledge of basic Spanish, so the grammar structures were very familiar, but Sarah teaches the concepts very well and it didn't seem like anyone had a great amount of trouble grasping the information.

This was my first time ever taking Italian, and I learned so much in just one semester. I learned the basics and introduction of the language and so much more. We also were introduced to Italian film, literature, and culture!
I have a strong foundation in basic concepts for speaking, reading, and writing Italian.
I learned how to speak, write, and I learned a lot about the culture through an immersive experience.
I gained a basic grasp of Italian grammar and pronunciation, and I also learned a lot about customs and how to address people in Italy.
How to speak, write, and learn a new language. I learned about a new culture
I began learning about Italian vocabulary and grammar. I learned how to read, write, and speak in Italian, at an elementary level.

I learned  about the significance of conversational practice when learning a new language. Prompted with partner discussion questions at the beginning of most classes, I learned to put the technical aspects of recent lessons into normal conversation.
I started to develop the skills needed to learn a new language.
How to speak, read, understand, and write in Italian.

Strengths of this course include a very welcoming learning environment, an understanding teacher that is willing to accommodate the needs of students, especially first years, and a good introduction to basic Italian concepts. There were not too many weaknesses, but the class did feel a bit slow sometimes.
The course was very good for any people first learning Italian like myself. It wasn't too fast-paced but it covered a good amount of material over the semester.
It is designed very well

Strengths: excellent teaching style, class interaction was wonderful and I got to practice actually speaking the language a lot more.
Weaknesses: nothing, Id just like a reminder on when VHLs are due.
Strengths-the Professor was great and I liked the setup, it was very fun

The workload of the course is not very heavy, which I greatly appreciated during the stressful period of midterms. However, sometimes, I would have liked a bit more assignments to encourage me to practice outside of class.
Amazing instructors that really want you to enjoy learning the Italian language and culture.
The course is very interactive with its students which I consider a strength.

strengths- everything!
weaknesses- hard to follow sometimes, often didn't complete exercises in the allotted times.

If you are looking for an L1 language class to help fulfill your language requirement, I would highly recommend ITAL 110 with Sarah. This class sparked my interest in Italian and it acted as more than just a class to fulfill a requirement.
Yes, if a student is looking to pursue a new language, I definitely recommend trying Italian!

I think this is a great language for people who have never spoken a language before and aren't looking to overwork themselves with French or something. The work of this class is super manageable and Sarah's energy makes every lesson exciting.
I would it a very great class
Definitely! This class was a joy to go to every morning and I highly recommend taking it as it is very interesting and stimulating.

Yes, Professor Atkinson is a spectacular teacher and gives each student full attention in whatever part of the class they may be struggling with. The workload is very fair and improves your knowledge of the subject.
Yes I loved it!! Such a fun and great department! The professors want you to learn and enjoy the class
Yes, for students interested in learning Italian.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student because I enjoyed the organization of the class.
YES. Great choice for your language requirement or just a fun extra language to learn.
Yes, if they are interested in learning Italian as it does require work, but I find that it is worth it.

It was great because there was a high correlation between what we studied and the feeling of learning. In some classes, after the final, you walk out feeling like you learned nothing, even if you did fine in the class. In this class, after every test I knew I knew more!
